title: US 30-year Treasury yield falls to new historic low
text: The yield on the 30-year Treasury bond dropped to a record low in the morning of Asian trading hours on Thursday, breaching the 2% level for its first time, according to Reuters.

title: Founder's grip on WeWork may be hard for investors to stomach
text: Investors in the upcoming initial public offering of WeWork's parent, The We Company, are being asked to lower their standards for corporate governance beyond what other technology startups have demanded, securities law experts said on Wednesday.

title: Oil prices extend losses as recession fears, inventories mount
text: Oil prices fell on Thursday to extend sharp overnight losses as U.S. crude inventories unexpectedly rose, fears of recession mounted and economic data out of China and Europe disappointed.

title: Markets Are in a Near-Term Panic, Direxion's Jablonski Says
text: Sylvia Jablonski, Direxion Investments managing director of capital markets, discusses the recent sell-off in the U.S. equity market with Bloomberg's Shery Ahn and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: Global stocks slide as bond markets send recession warning
text: Global stocks slumped to more than two-month lows in early Asian trade on Thursday, tracking the Wall Street slide as an inverted U.S. bond yield curve sent a flashing warning to investors about rising recession risks.

title: DoubleLine CEO Jeffrey Gundlach warns Fed rate cuts will not stop U.S. recession
text: Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, warned on Wednesday that rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve were not going to stop a recession from happening and that "once the Fed is in easing mode, it is already too late.

title: The Yield Curve Officially Inverts
text: The big news today is that the granddaddy yield curve inversion of them all — involving the 10-year Treasury and the 2-year U.S. note — has officially triggered.

title: The stock market's unusual pattern this week has historically been a big sell signal
text: The stock market has done something so unusual this week that it only happened 19 times in the past 30 years.

title: Markets Are Shaken by New Signs of Global Economic Trouble
text: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after reports showed a slowdown in China and a contraction in Germany, partly reflecting the U.S. trade war’s impact.

title: Cramer: Sell some stocks, but it's wrong to panic about a recession
text: "Our stock market is handcuffed to the bond market ... The momentum is with the bears, not the bulls," Jim Cramer says.

title: Economist El-Erian: Fed now has no choice but to cut rates or risk disrupting markets
text: Central bankers are being "held hostage" by markets, economist Mohamed El-Erian says.

title: President Trump calls Fed Chair Jerome Powell 'clueless' and inverted yield curve 'crazy'
text: Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland and Dan Roberts discuss the latest tweet by President Trump that criticizes Fed Chair Jerome Powell.

title: BofA Merrill's Ciana Says Yield Curve Could Invert 50 Basis Points, Gold May Hit $2,300
text: On this edition of "Smart Charts," Bank of America Merrill Lynch Chief FICC Technical Strategist Paul Ciana discusses the inversion of the 2-year/10-year yield curve and the outlook for gold prices with Bloomberg's Abigail Doolittle on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?

title: Yield curve inverts, what will the Fed do?
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung, Myles Udland and Dan Roberts break down the inverted yield curve, investing in bonds, and the Federal Reserve.

title: Yield curve inverts, should investors brace for a recession?
text: Are stocks on borrowed time?

title: Trump blasts the Fed
text: Steve Liesman on Trump's comments about the Fed.

title: Dow drops 800 points. Here are key levels to watch
text: Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth with key levels to watch in the markets. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Pete Najarian and Guy Adami.

title: Peter Schiff on recession warning: it's going to be worse than 2008
text: Euro Pacific Capital CEO Peter Schiff slams the Federal Reserve and says the U.S. is heading toward a recession.

title: Trump lifts tariffs on footwear industry for now and says Americans pay tariffs
text: The Footwear Distributors and Retailers of America (FDRA) is breathing a small sigh of relief as President Trump delays the implementation of additional tariffs on $300 billion of Chinese Goods.

title: Notion that today's sell-off a 'one-day' event is overly optimistic: FTSE Russell's Young
text: Peter Tuchman of Quattro Securities and Alec Young of FTSE Russell join CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the inverted yield curve and whether a recession is on a horizon.

title: CNBC's full interview with Allianz chief economic advisor El-Erian on the market sell-off
text: Mohamed El-Erian, chief economic advisor at Allianz, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the market sell-off and why he thinks central banks are being held hostage by markets.

title: Markets Panic For The Second Week In A Row
text: Recent market panic over economic weakness in Europe and a yield curve inversion is far from justified.

title: Another day, another reversal in stock fortunes as recession fears
text: U.S. stock markets plummeted today as recession fears continue to grow.

title: Analysts discuss inverted yield curve, market sell-off and buying opportunities
text: Payne Capital Management's Ryan Payne discusses and Allianz Global Investors Mona Mahajan discuss the inverted yield curve, the market sell-off and the global economy.

title: Fears About Global Economic Growth And A U.S. Recession Lead To Market Selloff
text: The stock market extended its losses today as investor anxiety ratcheted up amid dismal economic data and an inversion in the yield curve.

title: Here's what three strategists have to say as the Dow, Nasdaq close 3% lower
text: Jeff Saut, chief market strategist at Capital Wealth Planning; Joseph Tanious, principal and senior investment strategist at Bessemer Trust; and Chris Verrone, partner and head of technical and macro strategy at Strategas Research Partners, join CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the day's market action.

title: Dow plummets more than 800 points as investors fear recession
text: Wall Street sold off sharply on Wednesday, with the Dow dropping more than 800 points, the largest loss since October 2018 as investors feared a recession after the US Treasury yield curve temporarily inverted for the first time in 12 years. Based on the latest available data, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 800.49 points,.

title: Stocks Plunge As Investors See Signs Of A Slowing Global Economy
text: The Dow had its worst drop this year.

title: Fed Has Left Investors on Their Toes, Benchmark's Kelly Says
text: On this edition of "Options Insight," Benchmark Investments' Kevin Kelly discusses the recent stock market volatility with Bloomberg's Abigail Doolittle on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Markets Have Entered a New Volatility Regime, 3D Capital's Dugan Says
text: In this edition of "Charting Futures," 3D Capital Management President Eric Dugan discusses the recent market volatility and his investment strategy with Bloomberg's Abigail Doolittle on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: FTC chief prepared to break up Big Tech — if he ‘has to’
text: The head of the FTC said he's prepared to break up big tech companies by undoing past mergers as the agency probes whether the firms are hurting competition.

title: Markets register a shock, but is Trump right to blame the Fed?
text: It takes a lot to kill an economic expansion, typically requiring a major shock to bring growth to a halt and trigger a U.S. recession.

title: We cannot draw a U.S. recession conclusion from yield curve inversion, says Herb Morgan
text: Herb Morgan, chief investment officer at Efficient Market Advisors, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the day's market sell-off as markets come to a close.

title: Dow plunges 800 points amid recession fears
text: FOX Business’ Deirdre Bolton on the major decline in the Dow Jones industrial average.

title: Dow Jones plunges 800 points as recession fears rattle markets
text: Signs of a global economic slowdown roiled the markets on Wednesday as shares dived and investors fled to bonds with such intensity that short-term yields rose above longer-term ones for the first time since the crisis of a decade ago – an inversion many market-watchers saw as a strong signal of an approaching recession.

title: The yield curve just inverted – Jim Cramer and three other experts weigh in
text: The bond market just did something it hasn't done since 2007. Four experts break down what comes next.

title: Dow posts biggest one-day point drop since October
text: Wall Street sold off sharply on Wednesday, with the Dow registering its largest one-day point drop since October 2018 as investors were gripped by increased concerns about a recession after the U.S. Treasury yield curve temporarily inverted for the first time in 12 years.

title: You have to be concerned looking at the yield curve: Larry Summers
text: CNBC's "Closing Bell" team discusses the market sell-off amid the inverted yield curve with former treasury secretary Larry Summers.

title: Is it too early to panic over the inverted yield curve?
text: Yahoo Finance's Rick Newman looks at the inverted yield curve, the economy, and a possible recession in the future.

title: U.S. curve inverts for first time in 12 years; 30-year yield tumbles
text: The U.S. Treasury yield curve temporarily inverted on Wednesday for the first time since June 2007 in a sign of investor concern that the world's biggest economy could be heading for recession.

title: Trump: Our problem's with the Fed, not China
text: CNBC'CNBC's Eamon Javers reports on President Donald Trump's tweets about the U.S.-China trade, Fed chair Jerome Powell and the inverted yield curve.

title: US Indexes Close Lower Wednesday With Inverted Yield Curve Concerns
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 25,479.42 on Wednesday with a loss of 800.49 points or -3.05%.

title: Oil drops 3% on weak global economic data, U.S. crude stocks build
text: Oil prices shed 3% on Wednesday after fresh Chinese and European economic revived global demand fears and U.S. crude inventories rose unexpectedly for the second week in a row.

title: Inverted yield curve and global growth concern raise recession fears
text: Raymond James Chief Economist Scott Brown discusses the factors weighing heavily on markets including the inverted yield curve, the trade war, global growth and increased downside risks.

title: Pick companies with cash on the book, very little debt: Pro
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team discusses stock picks amid the market sell-off with Valerie Grant of Allianz and Kevin Caron of Washington Cross Advisors.

title: Trump hammers 'clueless Jay Powell' and the Fed, rails against 'crazy inverted yield curve'
text: President Donald Trump blames the Fed for concerns about a slowing U.S. economy after a yield curve inversion helps to send stocks falling.

title: Stocks, oil plunge on growing signs of global slowdown
text: Equity markets tanked and oil prices fell sharply on Wednesday after a closely watched bond indicator pointed to the growing  risk of a U.S. recession that was heightened by data showing Germany's economy in contraction and China's worsening.

title: Rising Global Recession Odds Signal More Credit And Market Risks For Financial Institutions
text: Bond markets in the U.S., U.K. and Europe are signalling rising odds of a global recession.

title: All 11 sectors of S&P 500 and all 30 Dow components sink as stock-market losses gather steam
text: Stock market losses gained steam late-afternoon Wednesday, with the S&P 500 and the Dow heading to one of the their worst losses of 2019 in a broad-market selloff.

title: To Help The Stock Markets Trump Retreated On Chinese Tariffs
text: The daily moves of the stock markets during August highlights how much influence the China trade war has on them. President Trump will continue to lash out against China, the Fed and any other organization he believes is hurting the markets and therefore his reelection chances.
